summary.p: 309 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 79; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 255 x 355mm; Script style: nasḫ; Date of production: 1271-72 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 32: "97 E. H. 79. Mushaf. Aharlı krem rengi vassaleli kâğıt. 355mm boy ve 255mm eninde 309 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli nesihle 150mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī eli ile. Bağdatta 670 (1271-72) de istinsah edilmiştir. Y 1a, Y. 1b ve 2a da dayire şeklinde ve madalyonlarla müzeyyen üç levha; Y. 2b ve 3a da müzehhep levha içinde Fātiḥa ve Eliflām yazılı. Sahifelerin kenarları Y. 228’e kadar halkâri. Satır aralan ve sure başları, ve cetveller yaldızla, duraklar kırmızı ile Y. 307b ve 308a müzehhep serlevhalı, Y. 308b, 309a da müdevver madalyonla 3 sayfa vardır. Miklep, şemse ve köşelikli ve oymalı siyah deri cilt."

This can be translated as follows: "97 E. H. 79. Muṣḥaf. Cream-colored sized paper with vaṣṣālī. 309 leaves of 355 mm height and 255 mm width. The text area written in naskh with diacritics, [contains] 14 lines measuring 150 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 670(1271-72) in Baghdad. There are three illuminated plates with medallions in the form of circle on [Leaf] L. 1a, L. 1b and 2a; illuminated plates written al-Fātiḥa and Alif-Lām on [Leaf] L. 2b and 3a. The edges are gilded (halkâri) up to [Leaf] L. 228. Interlineary spaces, sūra beginnings, and the rule-borders are gilded, verse seperators are in red. [Leaf] L. 307b and 308a are with illuminated serlevha. There are three plates with medallions in the form of circle on [Leaf] L. 308b and 309a. Black carved leather binding with flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse) and corner pieces.”
